decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Unnumbered historic maps, Unnumbered list entry information, Unnumbered listed features information, Osterley Park and Surrounding Area, Unnumbered monument types, Historic Buildings Sites and Monuments Record NW sector, Historic Buildings Sites and Monuments Record SW sector, Historic Buildings Sites and Monuments Record NE sector, Historic Buildings Sites and Monuments Record SE sector, Osterley Park & House - Spirit of Place 2015, National Trust Ownership Boundary Plan, Ecology Extended Phase 1 Survey 16001, Heritage Statement, Osterley Park Arboricultural Report, Planning Statement. Received 08/08/2016. Osterley Lane - Updated Proposal Illustration, Additional Information in relation to use of bridleway at Osterley Lane, Additional Information relating to the cycle skills area proposed for Osterley Park and House,  National Trust Cycle Trails Programme - Civil Engineering Design, Unnumbered trail build method, Osterley Pathway Improvement Project Interpretation & Wayfinding - proposed signage requirements. Received 11/11/2016. CS_050513_01_021 Rev: 0. Received 30/11/2016Statement of Significance, Unnumbered trail details. Received 12/12/2016. Unnumbered design for community cycle skills area. Received 20/12/2016; Response to drainage queries. Received 22/12/2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is brought into use

Condition : 3 - Within three months of the date of this permission a signage strategy sensitive to the setting of the parkland, detailing the scale, design and location of new signs along the extent of Osterley Lane which falls within the site boundary and throughout the site to ensure that cyclists are reminded of the need to respond appropriately to other users of the park shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. This shall be implemented and retained as approved.

Condition : 4 - The soft areas shown in figure 12 of the submitted Osterley Lane specification (route G - H - J - K (Osterley Lane Bridleway)) either side of the hard surface shall be retained and kept clear for use by horse riders.
description: Creation of multi-use trails, cycle trails, and a cycle skills proficiency area, including: 1) Upgrading and resurfacing existing surfaced tracks and paths; 2) Upgrading and surfacing of existing compacted earth paths; 3) Construction of new cycle trails, and 4) Construction of cycle skills area.
